name: Abandoned orders
description:
Events for abandoned orders.

An event will be emitted for every order that is abandoned. The abandoned time is defined by a string representing a UTC time in ISO 8601 format.

An order or a shopping cart can include multiple product types. These products are selected by the customer but never checked out.

Note that abandoned shopping cart events may include PII information about customers, such as email addresses. You may wish to redact this information if using the stream of events for insecure purposes.

Product descriptions in the carts follow a consistent pattern: They always start with the material/colour description (e.g. Stonewashed or Black) followed by a product type (e.g. Bootcut or Straight-leg) and finish with the product name (e.g. Jeans). These are not available as separate fields, so you may wish to parse the description string to identify events for specific types or colours of jeans for example.

certificates.subject: O=IBM Event Endpoint Management
certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: Cancellations
description:
Events for order cancellations recorded by the order management system.

An event will be emitted for every order that is cancelled.

Note that no specific information about the order details is included in the event. You could use the Orders topic to identify information about the order based on the orderid field in the cancellation event.

certificates.subject: O=IBM Event Endpoint Management
certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: Database updates
description: Stores updates in the PostgreSQL database table to demonstrate a JDBC sink connector.

certificates.subject: O=IBM Event Endpoint Management
certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: Door badge events
description:
Records an employee using their id badge to go through a door. This includes entry into the building overall, as well as entry through internal office doors.

Building exits do not require use of id badge, so a door badge in event does not imply that the employee will still be in the building.

Note that door events can take up to 3 minutes to reach the Kafka topic, so the badgetime value in the message payload should be treated as the canonical timestamp for the event.

This delay can be inconsistent, so messages on the topic are often out of sequence as a result.

certificates.subject: O=IBM Event Endpoint Management
certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: IoT sensor readings
description:
Readings from the logistics team's IoT network, capturing internal temperature and humidity data for areas where product is stored.

Note that sensor events can take up to 5 minutes to reach the Kafka topic, so the sensortime value in the message payload should be treated as the canonical timestamp for the event.
 The sensortime timestamp is a string in "EEE MMM dd HH:mm:ss zzz yyyy" format.

certificates.subject: O=IBM Event Endpoint Management
certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: Loosehanger building updates
description: Changes from the logistics system to building records. Events are emitted by a change data capture connector listening to the logistics database, and will be in Debezium format.

description: Messages to send to the KAFKA.IBMMQ queue on the IBM MQ queue manager. Messages should be sent as JSON messages, and will be converted into XML documents before transferring to IBM MQ.

name: New customer registrations
description: New customer registrations from the customer management system.

certificates.subject: O=IBM Event Endpoint Management
certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: Online orders
description:
Events from the online order management system.

An event will be emitted for every new online order that is made. The order time is defined by a string representing an UTC time in ISO 8601 format.

An online order can include several product types. Some products may run out-of-stock after they have been ordered.

Product stock shortages will be recorded as separate events.

Note that the online order events include PII information about customers so you may wish to redact this if using the stream of events for insecure purposes.

Product descriptions in the orders follow a consistent pattern: They always start with the item size (in capital letters, such as S, M, or XL), followed by a material/colour description (e.g. Stonewashed or Black) followed by a product type (e.g. Bootcut or Straight-leg) and finish with the product name (Jeans). These are not available as separate fields, so you may wish to cut the description string up to identify events for specific types or colours of jeans for example.

certificates.subject: O=IBM Event Endpoint Management
certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: Orders
description:
Events from the order management system.

An event will be emitted for every new order that is made.

Orders can only include a single product type. Customers purchasing multiple different types of products will be recorded as separate events.

The company uses a dynamic pricing algorithm, so the event will include the price of the item at the time of the order. This could be a different price for the same item in a different order on the same day.

Note that these events include PII information about customers so you may wish to redact this if using the stream of events for insecure purposes.

Product descriptions follow a consistent pattern: They always start with the item size (in capital letters, such as S, M, or XL), followed by a material/colour description (e.g. Stonewashed or Black) followed by a product type (e.g. Bootcut or Straight-leg). These aren't available as separate fields, so you may wish to cut the description string up to identify events for specific types or colours of jeans.

certificates.subject: O=IBM Event Endpoint Management
certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: Orders from IBM MQ
description: Orders received from the IBMMQ.KAFKA queue on the IBM MQ queue manager. Orders in MQ are processed as XML documents but are converted into JSON as part of transferring to the Kafka topic.

certificates.subject: O=IBM Event Endpoint Management
certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: Out of stock notifications
description:
Events for product stock shortages recorded by the online order management system.

An event will be emitted for some products after they have been ordered, preventing them to be delivered.

Note that the out-of-stock events include the full product definition (size, material, style, name) whereas the online order events include the product descriptions. You can retrieve the corresponding product description by concatenating the size, material, style and name properties separated by a space character.

certificates.subject: O=IBM Event Endpoint Management
certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: Product reviews
description:
Events for product reviews recorded by the product management system.

Some reviews may mention a size issue.

Note that product review events include the short product description like return request events.

certificates.subject: O=IBM Event Endpoint Management
certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: Return requests
description:
Events from the product management system.

An event will be emitted for every new return request that is issued. The return time is defined by a string representing an UTC time in ISO 8601 format.

A return request can include several product types with different return reasons provided by the customer. Some products may have reviews that have been posted. Some reviews may mention a size issue.

Product reviews will be recorded as separate events.

Note that the return request events include PII information about customers so you may wish to redact this if using the stream of events for insecure purposes.

Product short descriptions in the return requests follow a consistent pattern: They always start with the material/colour description (e.g. Stonewashed or Black) followed by a product type (e.g. Bootcut or Straight-leg) and finish with the product name (Jeans). These are not available as separate fields, so you may wish to cut the short description string up to identify events for specific types or colours of jeans for example.

certificates.issuer: CN=IBM Event Endpoint Management,O=IBM Event Endpoint Management

name: Stock movement updates
description:
This topic tracks movement to, from, and between warehouses.

Each event tracks the bulk movement of multiple instances of a single product type into a main warehouse.

NOTE: The systems that capture stock movement events will occasionally create duplicate events. It is important that any applications created using this topic are able to perform idempotent processing.
